title: Create
description: Creates a new admin
name: AdminAdd

Header.description: application/json

409.description: AdminAlreadyExists Admin account with that email address already exists.

title: AppCreate
description: Creates a application for the admin. The request body should contain the application itself.
name: AdminAppAdd

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN

title: RemoveApp
description: Removes an application from the admin.
name: AdminAppRemove

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

404.description: ApplicationNotFound Application with that ID doesn't exist.

title: UpdateApp
description: Updates an app
name: AdminAppUpdate

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

404.description: ApplicationNotFound Application with that ID doesn't exist.

title: Applications
description: Lists the application for the current admin
name: AdminApps

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN

title: Authenticate
description: Authenticates an admin and returns the authorization token
name: AdminAuthenticate

Header.description: application/json

Error 4xx.description: AdminBadLogin If the provided email and password are not correct

title: AuthorizeAdmin
description: Authorizes an admin to an application
name: AdminAuthorize

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

Parameter.description: Email address of the admin to authorize for the application

404.description: ApplicationNotFound Application with that ID doesn't exist.
AdminNotFound Admin with that email address does not exist

409.description: AdminAlreadyAuthorized Admin with email address already authorized for application

title: CreateContext
description: Creates a new context
name: AdminCreateContext

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

title: DeauthorizeAdmin
description: Deauthorizes an admin from an application
name: AdminDeauthorize

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

Parameter.description: Email address of the admin to deauthorize from the application

404.description: ApplicationNotFound Application with that ID doesn't exist.
AdminNotFound Admin with that email address does not exist.
AdminNotFoundInApplication Admin does not belong to this application.

409.description: AdminDeauthorizeLastAdmin Admin with email address cannot be deauthorized because he's the only one left. We can't have "orphan" applications.

title: Delete
description: Deletes the currently logged admin.
name: AdminDelete

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN

title: UserDelete
description: Deletes an user from an application
name: AdminDeleteUser

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

Parameter.description: The username of an user from an application

title: GetContext
description: Retrieves a context
name: AdminGetContext

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

title: GetContexts
description: Get all contexts
name: AdminGetContexts

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

title: GetContexts
description: Get all contexts
name: AdminGetContexts

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

title: GetSchemas
description: Gets the model schema for an application
name: AdminGetSchemas

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

title: GetSchemas
description: Gets the model schema for an application
name: AdminGetSchemas

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

description: Gets all users of the application
name: AdminGetUsers

The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

description: Gets all users of the application

The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

title: Me
description: Gets information about the logged admin
name: AdminMe

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN

title: RemoveAppModel
description: Removes a model from the application (all items of this type will be deleted)
name: AdminRemoveAppModel

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

title: RemoveContext
description: Removes a context and all associated objects
name: AdminRemoveContext

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

title: Update
description: Updates the currently logged admin. Every property in the request body is used to update the admin.
name: AdminUpdate

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN

400.description: InvalidAdmin Invalid admin ID in the patch object

title: UpdateContext
description: Updates the context object
name: AdminUpdateContext

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

Error 4xx.description: [021]ContextNotAllowed This context doesn't belong to you

title: UpdateSchema
description: Updates the model schema
name: AdminUpdateSchema

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

title: UserUpdate
description: Updates an user from an application
name: AdminUpdateUser

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID

Parameter.description: Array of patches containing describing the updates

title: GetContext
description: Retrieves a context
name: GetContext

Header.description: application/json
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application

title: GetContexts
description: Get all contexts
name: GetContexts

Header.description: application/json
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application

title: Register
description: Registers a new device or updates an already existing one. If device UDID is supplied in info it will try to search for a device with this UDID and return the device ID.
name: DeviceRegister

Header.description: application/json
Custom header containing the device ID if you want to update device info, or 'TP_EMPTY_UDID' string when you want to register a new device (a device id will be generated in this case)
Custom header containing the application ID on which to register the device
Custom header containing the hashed API key

Error 4xx.description: [004]MissingRequiredField When registering a new device and info field is missing
[025]DeviceNotFound When updating existing device that doesn't exist

title: Count
description: Gets the object count of a certain filter/subscription
name: ObjectCount

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application

title: Create
description: Creates a new object. The object is not immediately created.
name: ObjectCreate

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application

Parameter.description: The type of object to subscribe to

title: Delete
description: Deletes an object. The object is not immediately deleted.
name: ObjectDelete

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application

title: Subscribe
description: Subscribe to an object or a collection of objects (by a filter). Returns a the resulting object(s). Subsequent subscription on the same channel and filter will have no effect but will return the objects.
name: ObjectSubscribe

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application
Custom header containing the device ID (obtained from device/register)

Error 4xx.description: [027]InvalidChannel When trying to subscribe to an invalid channel

title: Unsubscribe
description: Unsubscribe to an object or a collection of objects (by a filter)
name: ObjectUnsubscribe

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application
Custom header containing the device ID (obtained from device/register)

Parameter.description: Object representing the filters for the channel

examples.title: Client Request

Error 4xx.description: [027]InvalidChannel When trying to subscribe to an invalid channel

title: Update
description: Updates an existing object. The object is not updated immediately.
name: ObjectUpdate

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application

Parameter.description: The type of object to subscribe to
An array of patches that modifies the object

title: Refresh Token
description: Sends a new authentication token to the user. The old token must be provide (and it may or not may not be already expired).
name: RefreshToken

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application
Custom header containing the device ID (obtained from device/register)

title: Delete
description: Deletes a user
name: UserDelete

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application

title: Login
description: Log in the user through Facebook or Twitter.
name: UserLogin

Header.description: application/json
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application
Custom header containing the device ID (obtained from device/register)

Error 4xx.description: [028]InsufficientFacebookPermissions User email is not publicly available (insufficient Facebook permissions)

title: Password login
description: Logs in the user with a password
name: UserLoginPassword

Header.description: application/json
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application
Custom header containing the device ID (obtained from device/register)

Error 4xx.description: [031]UserBadLogin User email and password did not match

title: Logout
description: Logs out the user removing the device from his array of devices.
name: UserLogout

Header.description: application/json
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application
Custom header containing the device ID (obtained from device/register)

title: Me
description: Info about logged user
name: UserMe

Header.description: application/json
The authorization token obtained in the login endpoint. Should have the format: Bearer $TOKEN
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application
Custom header containing the device ID (obtained from device/register)

title: Password Reset
description: Resets the password of the user based on a token
name: UserPasswordReset

Header.description: application/json
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application

title: Register
description: Registers a new user using a Facebook token or directly with an email and password. User is not created immediately.
name: UserRegister

Header.description: application/json
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application
Custom header containing the device ID (obtained from device/register)

Parameter.description: GET param for the login provider (can be "username" for registering without a 3rd party)

Error 4xx.description: [028]InsufficientFacebookPermissions User email is not publicly available (insufficient facebook permissions)
[029]UserAlreadyExists User with that email address already exists

title: Request Password Reset
description: Requests a password reset for the user, an email is sent to its email address
name: UserRequestPasswordReset

Header.description: application/json
Custom header which contains the application ID
Custom header containing the SHA256-ed API key of the application

title: Update
description: Updates the user information. This operation is not immediate.
name: UserUpdate

Parameter.description: Array of patches that describe the modifications
